author: daxian-dbw
body:
### Summary of the new feature / enhancement

The `$ErrorView` variable was introduced earlier than `$PSStyle`. But with `$PSStyle` containing configuration like `$PSStyle.Formatting` and `$PSStyle.Progress`, it feels to me the error view configuration should be moved to `$PSStyle` as well, for consistency and easier discoverability.

### Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

Discard the `$ErrorView` variable (breaking change), add the public property `ErrorView` to `System.Management.Automation.PSStyle`.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: We could simplify codes if we moved $host.UI.SupportsVirtualTerminal detection in PSStyle too.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
> We could simplify codes if we moved $host.UI.SupportsVirtualTerminal detection in PSStyle too.

I don't think we should do that because the engine is supposed to be agnostic to the host capabilities. Think about the scenario where PowerShell is hosted in a Windows GUI application.

comments.author: dkaszews
comments.body: Idea for softer transition without breaking change just yet: make `$ErrorView` getters and setters forward to `$PSStyle.ErrorView` with a deprecation warning, similarly how code libraries deprecate functions. Then we can fully remove it in another major release or next one. That way people who update regularly will get some time to adjust.

title: Consider moving the `$ErrorView` configuration to `$PSStyle`
